ygData.subject: Re: spell procs
ygData.msgSnippet: well...i ve poked through the .eff files myself [a basic hex capable editor will do the trick] and i haven t run into anything which could be interperted as
ygData.messageBody:
well...i've poked through the .eff files myself [a basic hex capable editor
will do the trick] and i haven't run into anything which could be
interperted as delay data. certainly nothing noted as such. though, it was
some time ago when i did this...so things could have changed.

could this spell be the file reference of the soul leech's effect? it would
not be the only proc effect which differs in file reference and in-game
description. if this delay data does in fact exist...it may refer to the
frequency with which this effect can proc...rather than an actual delay in
casting.

or possibly the spell's "recycle time" if it is in fact a castable spell.
two minutes seems far to long to be actual "casting time".

-kg


>From: Grant Vanderhule <vandergm@...>
>Reply-To: shadowknight@onelist.com
>To: shadowknight@onelist.com
>Subject: [shadowknight] spell procs
>Date: Fri, 1 Oct 1999 10:53:44 -0500
>
>From: Grant Vanderhule <vandergm@...>
>
>i dont think these are weapon procs.. NO weapon proc has a delay higher
>than
>0.1 seconds, or it'd be interrupted during normal combat movement. also no
>weapon proc has a time delay after using..
>
>by the way, how do you read the .eff files without getting a bunch of
>gobbldegook? :)
>
>Beld Demonblade
>Fennin Ro
>
